title: Ticket #5813: shared_port daemon should be careful about FD use
description:
The shared port daemon should check before accepting connections if it's within some small number of its configured maximum number of FDs. If it is, it should defer accepting new connections until it has an FD (or MAX_ACCEPTS_PER_CYCLE?) free to do so.

(It may have to be two FDs per MAX_ACCEPT, because the shared port daemon both accept()s a connection and almost immediately opens the corresponding domain socket (or whatever) to shove that FD down.)

(Alternately, the shared port daemon should check before that open(), as well.)
